page.title: 01Blanchland & Ruffside Area
page.content: Blanchland & Ruffside are small hill farming communities on the W Durham, Northumberland border with a typical Pennine climate. Land & houses are mainly rented from the Lord Crewe Trust. Energy sources are coal, wood, electricity & calor gas. People work on farms, nearby mineral mines or commute to Hexham, Shotley Bridge & Newcastle. On the moorland areas are gamekeepers. Blanchland Abbey & area is popular with tourists & of historical interest. There is an over 60's club, WI, Mother & Toddler Group & various sports teams. The old school is now an art gallery. School children have transport to Slaley, Corbridge, Hexham & thrice daily to Consett, none on Sundays. Cars tend to be necessities.
